author: HelaJ
title: Our visit to minor injuries
body: I cannot understand how NHS Borders are able to class Haylodge Hospital as a Minor Injuries Unit. My son cut his leg when out riding his bike and the person who provided first aid recommended going there to get it stitched. When we arrived the nurse from the ward had a look and said there was nothing she could do and if we wanted it stitched we would have to go to the BGH. The ‘minor injuries unit’ we were encouraged to attend could provide no more service than I could at home. NHS Borders try to encourage people to use Minor Injuries Units to take some pressure off the main A& E, but if that is going to work, I feel they need to staff them with people who can provide the service required. In my opinion a minor injuries unit should be able to clean and stitch a wound and give someone a tetanus shot at the very least.

author: Patient1985
title: Lincoln hospital
body:
I was asked to come to a+e to get an admission to MEAU as requested by my consultant and during my time waiting in a+e the nurses made my experience unsettling as they keep saying the consultant isn't allowed to do this and I cant understand why you are here. I felt very uncomfortable, I wasn't waiting long for a bed on MEAU, but I felt during my time waiting the nurses and doctors were pointing and handing my letter around aggressively.  
During my time on MEAU I was told not to unpack as I was going to Dixon ward, I waited until 8.30pm to be told they were waiting on a doctor to start my treatment, a few hours had passed and I was still waiting for treatment when a staff nurse came over to tell me we have requested a doctor, but they are busy. During this time I felt that another treatment was given in an aggressive way, my anxiety was worsening as I was confused with this awful hospitality. After mid-night a doctor came to start treatment, however the treatment I was suppose to be given was discussed properly before hand. I was told the treatment to be given was this or nothing, I was shocked by this and tried the treatment the doctor was offering at the time, but unfortunately the treatment was unsuccessful and was left in a state of tears, shaking and in pain. By this time I was very upset and wanted to discharge myself as I felt the whole experience I received was very poor. I asked to speak to a nurse and discuss my concerns and my worries and that I wanted to discharge myself, there was no advice given saying you need to stay for treatment or that we can discuss other treatments. They took my cannula out straight away and helped me leave. I have write a letter to my consultant about my concerns and upset.

author: fornaxjn93
title: Excellent Service
body:
Every member of staff I came into contact with throughout my time in the hospital from the start to finish was outstanding!  
The COVID19 precautions and measures implemented are clear and effective throughout the hospital, but particularly in the Oral Surgery Unit.  
Reception staff are friendly and well organised. Very efficient that reception appeared to be asking all patients at the reception desk various questions about recent contact with Coronavirus. It didn’t take more than a minute to be checked in - thank you to Donna for arranging an x-ray with the radiography team on arrival into the department.  
The radiographer (whose name I don’t know, apologies) was excellent and very quick to call me into the room just off from the waiting room. I couldn’t have been waiting more than 5 minutes before being called in to take the necessary radiographs before seeing the Surgeon.  
I would like to say a special thank you to the Oral Surgeon (Chris) and his Specialist Dental Nurse (Laura) for their time. I was slotted in as an urgent patient on their clinic this afternoon and I couldn’t be more grateful. The clinic assessment I received was extremely efficient, I felt I had time to address all my concerns. A full medical history was carried out and prompt diagnosis. I was given all of my treatment options and how it could be carried out by Chris. Laura was fantastic in her nursing manner, always anticipating and being prepared for the next request e.g. my prescription. Both Chris and Laura worked well together and wonderfully professional. THANK YOU BOTH SO SO MUCH for being incredibly kind.I have no concerns about returning for the second part of my treatment in the Oral Surgery Department. At this point I highly recommend as a place for great service (and I anticipate treatment likewise). Wonderful all round and well deserved 5* rating!!

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

author: Tc00
title: Birth of first baby was a fantastic experience
body:
We welcomed our son into the world at the start of May at Peterhead Maternity unit and the experience was fantastic.  
Right from the start my midwife Natalie couldn't be anymore helpful along with the rest of the staff in the unit.  
We want to say a special thank you to everyone who made the birthing experience so special and we wouldn't hesitate to recommend Peterhead maternity unit to anyone.

author: Mif
title: Dermatology
body:
I was referred back to Dermatology LRI at the end of February with a suspect mole, having had a long history of skin cancer including a melanoma.  
I have previously had some excellent care and some very poor with mistakes with biopsy results. Naturally I was very nervous about the suspect mole.  
The main difficulty experienced was with communication resulting in inefficiency and delay causing problems and stress for both patients and staff. Staff said they had reported the problems to management many times.  
I was given letter/ leaflet with an incorrect telephone number which turned out to be a misprint so likely to have been given to many patients, another number provided was with a full answerphone and the number given for biopsy results had an answerphone were messages were not answered.  
I eventually found out my biopsy results yesterday after a call to my GP surgery who had been sent a letter over a month ago. No communication to me what so ever .  
Naturally very upset and frustrated about this and I phoned Dermatology to be told the reason was to do with the Covid situation in India. I was astounded to hear that in some way this was to do with the delay.  
Speechless!  
Any explanation?

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Leicester NHS Trust

author: branxt36
title: a compliment to staff
body:
My 78yr old Dad attended ED in May.  
I would like to thank everyone who helped him - from reception staff- to the lovely nurse who treated him very well.  
I do not know her name but thank you so much for looking after him, when you were chatting you stated your dad worked where my Dad had worked.  
Anyhow reception staff were helpful to me and let my dad know I had arrived and was waiting for him  
Very well done everyone--- thanks a million

author: Our story
title: Pre assessment swabs
body:
It’s funny how the pre assessment for surgery can be very scarey... and now there is a new dimension of going for COViD test. Mum was very anxious about her surgery but even more anxious about the process to be tested for Covid. We went to the drive through unit at the Woodside Road in Ballymena and it was so well organised- it is to be commended at the respect and efficiency of the team conducting the test and how calm they were conducting the tests.... which look extremely uncomfortable for someone, but when the staff are efficient and reassuring it makes all the difference. The only improvement would have been to advised us that the nurse would conduct the test.  
Most of mums anxiety related to the fact she thought she would have to do it to herself and she wasn’t sure she could.  
We are very grateful for the service and delighted the results were negative (efficiently informed by text message 24hours later) and mum is safely in for surgery. As a family we are very grateful for the role this team is played

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust

author: julygr43
title: My care today.
body: I had to take my son to out of hours today at Douglas street Hamilton. My son is autistic & had croup, however due to covid I had to bring him to be seen just incase. We seen a Dr Coates, and I can honestly say I wish he was my local GP. He signed Makaton with my son the whole way through the appointment and really took the time to listen to me & my partner about what was going on for my son because he couldn’t communicate this himself. I was really pleased and grateful that there are doctors like him around. Thank you again.

readBy.name: St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students

author: quebecgr58
title: Communication
body:
When I was at the appointment the nurse asked me to get on the bed; I asked what happens next to which they just replied just sit on the bed and we'll sort it out; which made me feel really manipulated because I'm a human, and if you're gonna stick something down my penis I should at least be informed about it before hand. I know that is for my future health and it's important, and it would of course been okay But they took away that decision away. They held back the information until I was exposed (trousers down) and at my most vulnerable. That's not the right time to explain the procedure. A better time would of been when I asked before what was going to happen.  
They withheld the information and didn't allow me to make my own decision.  
That wasn't right  
And as a side note and not to distract from my main point but on my 2 visits the nurses were quite apathetic. Not a real problem and I understand they must see 100s of people a week and can't care about everyone but I didn't feel listened to. in short bedside manner could be improved but I would not of mentioned bedside manner if the first incident had not happened and would not of filled in this form so make of that what you will.  
Thanks

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

author: DJS72!
title: Care received at ARI
body: I collapsed at work and an ambulance was called. Two lovely guys Nick and Johnny attended. I felt very bewildered and embarrassed, but they put me at ease and even managed to make me laugh (no easy feat as I felt pretty horrible). They took me to A& E at Aberdeen Royal Infirmary and was transferred to the care of Libby and a Doctor called Dennis. Again they were both so kind. I was kept informed the whole way through of the tests and what was happening. There was also a lady who’s name I think was Pamela, (sorry if this wasn’t your name) she took my obs, gave me a pair of socks (shoes left at work! ) and also escorted me to the toilet. She was chatty and friendly and helped me to relax. Genuinely there was just nothing that I could point out to be improved with any of the dealings I had with any of these hard-working people. You are all a credit to your profession and I send a sincere Thank you to you all.

readBy.name: Office of Alexander Burnett, MSP for Aberdeenshire West

author: ermimjoe
title: Not enough support
body:
My normal Deaf services team were all off for two weeks.  
During that time, I had no support, despite my usual worker informing Rushcliffe LMHT that I needed it by text.  
When they did respond to me asking for help, they just said to go and do something or they ring me despite being Deaf.  
The crisis team's help has been awful, because all they do is say that they will tell the LMHT, which basically puts me in a circle of non responses.  
I feel like I’ve been played, and I don’t have any worth to the teams.  
I had to rely on colleague to give me support.  
I overdosed and refused treatment because I didn’t feel I was worth saving.  
I’m worried that if my team are off again, I will be left with no support again.

author: Zholl29
title: Regular visits
body:
Nurses and doctors have been treating me for various reasons. I’ve been returning for regular vaccinations also including hepatitis and hpv.
Hopefully I’m now on the waiting list for prep. Staff are always very professional and friendly. Always a nice environment to attend even if the subject matter isn’t that pleasant.
I feel safe in the hands of this clinic

author: februaryqb75
title: Coming on in leaps and bounds
body:
I became an addict at a early age. Throughout my life I struggled with life. I am a father, and wish to be around for them. Most important for myself, if I'm no good, then I'm no good for anyone else.  
After booking myself into a recovery programme, I have come on leaps and bounds. I now volunteer for the project I'm in, doors are starting to open up.

author: scorecardjm77
title: Removal of mirena coil
body: Expertly and kindly removed by gentle and empathetic practitioner. I am very grateful.

author: carinatr44
title: Support over the years
body:
Started taking drugs in 1997, First used services in Dorset.  
Landed in jail 2007 as a result of shoplifting for my drug habit  
Came out of jail and picked up again, in 2008 my doctor referred me to Inclusion  
Started on a methadone script 75ml a day  
reduced over the years to 20mg, went onto subutex in 2015 and have been slowly reducing ever since in /04ml at a time.  
Finally off everything Feb 2021 - its now April.  
Had a lot of support over the years; ups and downs, but finally free. After 13 years of being in the service. Thank you to Inclusion staff especially Tina  
Could never have done it without you

author: Cr66se
title: Wig Fitting at The Fern Centre
body: It was a great and friendly service!

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: CATINTHEHAT
title: Fern Centre Wig Service
body: Fantastic! Was worried about wearing wigs, but the staff knew exactly what I was after - very pleased.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: romeohx88
title: Kind help and expertise
body:
My wife was diagnosed with dementia by IHTT team 5 years ago. We carried on with life, with her condition slowly getting worse for 4 1/2 years. Then she got an infection and became aggressive. I called IHTT team again. They helped myself and my daughter tremendously. Came to see us everyday and had time to talk to my wife and myself. When she got aggressive, I called the team and they came straight out. They arranged with social services a care home for her, and accompanied me when I took her in.  
Unfortunately the care home called me out to take her back home, as they hadn't got the proper facilities she needed for her care.  
We took her to A and E next day and they put her into, section 2. I am writing this 6 weeks later and she is still in hospital for assessment.  
I would like to thank all the staff at Byron House for their kind help and expertise.

author: melonhb58
title: You have to put the effort in
body:
College really helps with all kinds of different strategies to help you on your journey.  
All of these tools they give you will help! You Have To Put The Effort In!  
Make sure to re-read your college work as writing it down whilst listening is a struggle for me! You can't remember everything that is said so always have paper, notebook pen/pencil with you as you always learn something new everyday!  
These guys have been through it as well! Make sure to always ask questions if confused/worried about anything!

author: chamaeleonhm74
title: Neonatal care
body: I had my son four weeks early, he was placed in special care where he received very good care. The staff on the neonatal unit were excellent and very supportive to my son and myself, I can’t say anything bad about my experience, they have a great team that works well. Thank you

author: Pennylou
title: Ward 1E lovely and relaxed
body: My daughter was sent to this ward as her speciality ward was full. Over the months we’ve seen a few different wards outside oncology but 1E has truly blown others out the park with care, friendliness and knowledge. There is a lovely relaxed vibe to the ward which certainly helps calm down anxious parents and nothing is too big an ask.

author: Crazy frog
title: Going to hospital
body: I had to get a blood test and   I was scared. The nurses, doctors made me feel better and Jamie the play therapist was my favourite! He gave me a bracelet and Lego to take home for being brave. It was better than I thought it was going to be I wanted to stay for tea: )

author: Veetroon7
title: Colonoscopy
body:
Had colonoscopy (camera). Absolutely terrific staff made the procedure less stressful. Very informative caring staff especially Gemma and Julie who put me at ease.  
Not the pleasantest thing to have done, but couldn't of asked for more reassurance.  
Brilliant patient care thankyou

author: Hand problem
title: My hospital admission
body: I have an auto immune disease have been shielding working from home full time, I am a trust employee and became unwell with a hand infection last month. Admitted to ward 4C through A&E, I was in safe professional hands from admission to discharge. I felt the medical team, nursing, physiotherapy and OT team were very skilled experienced and were most diligent in my care. Now recovering well with follow up, in the hands of physiotherapy and reflect on my care very positively I am most grateful . Thank you

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Morwenna
title: Covid 19 testing cell at North Devon DH
body:
Attending for the test was fine. It is slightly annoying that the hospital wouldn't accept a PCR test done more local to where I live or by post, which would have saved me an hour drive each way just to have the swab taken.  
All the staff were charming and efficient.  
The result arrived promptly later in the day. I needed the test prior to an operation planned for Saturday.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: monney68
title: COVID Vaccine for HSC Staff
body:
Apart from initial teething problem in booking system COVID vaccine at RVH vaccine centre was impressively slick.  
Everyone involved was terrific the friendly door man and support staff around the staff were so good and so patient everyone.  
Inside the centre they had everything organised to the last to ensure spacing of people and reassurance for all.  
The nurses on both occasions were brilliant. Sadly a month later I can’t remember their names but to all involved I’d like to say Thanks. And to all in the back offices that helped organise such a huge and important vaccine program that gives us hope and protection be proud for what’s been achieved so far. And please ensure that it continues for the rest of population.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: cdkbo'ness
title: surgical skin team
body: Had to visit FVRH day surgery BAU contingency surgical skin team, David and Lynda made me feel relaxed before, during, after op and explained what to expect after op very clearly.

author: woodpigeonzn53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Well looked after at hospital appointment
body:
I was very anxious about coming into a hopsital after isolating last year due to Covid19. I found the Oral Surgery Unit to be very safe and well signposted. I was spaced out nicely in the reception waiting area.  
The nurses looking after me, Donna and Lisa were both very kind and were understanding of my anxieties. They chatted with me whilst the Dr was occupied.  
I saw a Dr called Jamie who was also very patient with me and made me feel at ease.  
Overall very happy with my visit.

author: LozzyBee224
title: Difficult Stay, some good staff
body: I found a lot of my stay really difficult, it was hard to think about redoing my GCSES when I was on the ward and I found lots of the people I was there with really triggering. there was often lots of noise, distress and restraints. I was allowed headphones to block the noise a lot, mostly in the dining room which helped. I didn't feel like I got too much therapy work. I did enjoy when my parents could visit and I could see my cat sometimes too when they came. my favourite staff was Izzy, she always took the time to listen and understand me or play games. I also really liked steph and some of the nurses were good too.

author: Babeeree70
title: My neurologist appointment
body: I was told I had to get a video of my seizures before I could get treatment but I live alone they happen when I’m alone so how the hell am I supposed to solve it? ? ? ? They were very rude and abrupt to me too I was crying after the phone appointment so I hope they're happy with themselves this whole thing has been a joke! !

author: Megs_96
title: Mental health services A&E
body:
I contacted a charity for mental health which advised me to go to the hospital as they were concerned for my mental health as I was going to take my life, I had too tell my story 3 separate times one to a nurse one to a doctor then finally the mental health nurse I assume?  
After an 8 hours wait. The mental health nurse said three things too me which I feel is the worst thing to say to someone who is suicidal: first was there’s no magic pill to fix this, then they said life is sh*t, and also what do you expect me to do nothing is open. I was left feeling angered and hopeless I was in crisis and this person only made it worse I also punched the wall and broke my hand because of it.

author: Anna L
title: Sick with Hemochromatosis
body: I am sick with Chemochromatosis Im feeling bad I should be bleeding half A liter of blood every month. The last time I had was in September last year

readBy.name: London North West University Healthcare NHS Trust

author: Ashghirl
title: Registered unpaid carer still awaiting jag
body:
Registered as unpaid carer over 5 weeks ago, been calling the helpline for updates since week 2 was informed I’m on the system however there is a back log of 3 weeks, called back following week to be informed it’s now 3.5 weeks back log, called again week 4 to be informed there is still a back log (not told how long this time) but I’m still on the system, just off the call today to be told still a back log.  
I’m frustrated now as I work in a shop part time however I am an unpaid carer for my dad (who is housebound, he also spent 8 weeks in hospital due to contracting covid) I spend most of my time in my room (includes eating meals) so I don’t pass anything onto him, if I am sitting with him in living room I have a mask on, can someone please advise as this isn’t good for my own mental health (I suffer from anxiety)

author: memberrt39
title: ACL reconstruction- ward 207
body: Yesterday I had surgery and the care received from all professionals was outstanding. Everyone who spoke with me was caring and compassionate and was extremely professional. Thank you for everything.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Derby and Burton NHS Foundation Trust

author: Haribo1999
title: Vaccination Clinic
body: I visited the clinic on Saturday 15th May 2021. I was a bit nervous because I don't like needles but I was put at ease from the moment I stepped through the entrance to the hospital.   Everyone in the clinic was so kind and friendly. I feel so grateful for having my first dose so thanks for making my experience bearable.

title: Poor example of compassion
body: My experience of A&E and the day care bit that adds on, is not good. Some people were fantastic and it's important to note this, but as an institution the NHS clearly carries some with poor attitude and who do not live up to their values. It needs some good management which it is lacking. e.g. I was feeling unwell, and many nurses walked on through. The lady who was cleaning stopped what she was doing and made the nurse sort it. So attitudes at the opposite ends.

title: Booking appointment problem
body: The practitioner requested an appointment for 11th May my previous appointment but I had not been contacted by 7th May. I contacted HH but was told I did not have an appointment time. I requested speaking to a manager or supervisor but told they were all in a meeting with from my position was an untruth. Not good enough. I went to the clinic to let practioner aware her request for an appointment had not been actioned. I did not expect to be treated but she insisted she would carry out the treatment. I would like it to be recorded that she put right the wrong of HH by not doing their job properly and how grateful I am to her. I was contacted on the 16th May to agree the next appointment date and was told I would be sent a text message to confirm the agreed date and time. Today is 18th May. I have still not received the text message!!!!!!

title: Wonderful Service
body: Dermatology Service is second to none and the wonderful advice given you cannot fault.  Caring of the patients is outstanding well done

title: Amazing practice
body: Great experience, a very kind doctor who has a lot of knowledge and informs patients of everything, he gives very good advices. Everyone are very helpful and demonstrating a lot of experience.

title: Very nice people
body: I’ve had to bring my son here for an eye condition several times now and every single member of staff has always been so helpful and friendly both with him and me, especially the gentleman at the door to the main entrance who goes out of his way to help everyone find where they are going!

title: Getting the Astrazenica vaccination
body:
got my second vaccination today. like the first vaccination, it was straightforward and quick. The surgery phoned me up the day before, booked a slot and on the day I waited about 5 mins before seeing the person. 

Very impressed with the Surgery and staff, they have been super efficient and the whole process is easy.
Thanks to all those involved and I'd recommend people take up the offer when they get the call.

title: Excellent care
body: The GP was considerate, patient and supportive. I felt both reassured and informed from the first discussion via phone to the in-person consultation. The GP has a relaxed and respectful manner that I found very helpful.

title: Superb from start to finish
body:
Cataract replaced yesterday. My appointment was for 10.30am and I left the hospital at 11.55am. Job done! Astonishing turnround!Woke up this morning to find that I have brilliant vision. Thrilled to bits. SpaMedica were wonderful. Excellent literature to explain every facet of procedure. Exceptional staff who constantly gave me great assurance throughout. I am truly grateful to you all. Thank you so much.
Went for a local walk this morning to enjoy my enhanced eyesight but found that I couldn’t stop myself from reading car registration plates.

title: Poor service
body:
Having always rated this surgery outstanding I am disappointed to be writing today to say how disgusted I am that a simple repeat prescription request can go so wrong and be impossible to sort out.
The reception staff have tried to sort out my problem but the lack of available appointments and doctors means I cannot have my heart medication prescribed and cannot get anyone to sort out the issue. I have tried the recommended econsultation and have received a reply that states that due to unprecedented demand I may have to wait longer than usual for a reply. 
Someone needs to join the dots here. The unprecedented demand is due to the fact the reception staff are telling everyone to go online because there aren’t any appointments available!
I am now faced with the Russian roulette system of being on the phone at exactly 8am tomorrow morning to try and get a same day appointment in the hope I can get my heart medication before the weekend.
Such a shame, this used to be such a superb, caring place.

title: Pathology service great!
body: I have been having bloods done monthly for long time. Queues have been long. But staff have always communicated with the queue. The wait can be long, due to high demand on this service. Thank you to you all at qe2 pathology, you are always efficient and kind. Even when the public are not to you. Thank you for providing a great service in very challenging times. It’s appreciated.

title: covid 19 vaccination
body: I had both my covid vaccinations at whitley house & found it to be extremley well organised ,did not have to wait long ,all the staff were very friendly & profesional & the volunteers were superb ,I could not fault the servisce i recieved at all top marks

title: Fantastic staff
body: After having a left hip replacement, the staff and surgeons are excellent, they look after you and explain everything fully ,makes you feel at ease, they are caring and can’t do enough for you,the staff are constantly looking after your needs and making sure you are ok ,they are cheerful and smiling and makes recovery quickly, the wards are very clean and bright and would definitely recommend to anyone that is going to have surgery.

title: Great e-consult
body: I used the e-consult service to deal with an issue and was very impressed with the service I received! I had a prescription sent to my nearest pharmacy within one and a half hours of completing the form.

title: Amazing Life Saving Care
body:
My relative was brought by ambulance bleeding heavily. The first person to greet me at A+E reception ( Friday approximately 6pm 14 May) was kind, smiling and so helpful, I was directed to the resuscitation unit immediately.
 The A+E staff and surgical team on call worked tirelessly to save her life. They did this with cool professionalism whilst being compassionate and taking time to keep us informed. The hospital was clean and well organised. 
It was a really difficult situation but the amazing doctors and nurses made all the difference. My relative is now recovering in another hospital transferred after Croydon University Hospital had stabilised her condition 
The whole family are so grateful to you all

title: Very well Organised
body: Very welcoming staff, extremely well organised. Very clean - large practice - very positive experience.

title: Great Practice
body: I would like to thank the Colorectal Team at Leighton Hospital. I was very anxious about having a colonoscopy but the whole team put me at ease and I had absolutely no need to be nervous. Thank you all for your patience and understanding.

readBy.name: Mid Cheshire Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Exceptional patient care
body: I joined this practice in 2020 and have had a very positive experience. I have been able to book telephone consultations quickly and easily. My GP is highly skilled, knowledgeable and very thorough in their assessment. I have been able to discuss my health concerns and made to feel very comfortable. I have been seen for face-to-face consultations where necessary. My GP always goes above and beyond in their delivery of patient care and I would highly recommend this practice.

title: Great service
body:
Although I don't have medical service here so far, the reception man was so kind and helpful when registering as new patient.
I am Japanese and don't speak English well, but he explained so slow and clearly.His explanation was very easy to understand.
I appreciate very much.

title: Great practice
body: Support received from the GP is fantastic. GP is patient and explains everything thoroughly. I feel that I am being listened to and end leaving with peace of mind. Excellent service and support. Thank you

title: Problem with breathing and arm in pain
body:
My breathing was causing me problems, with telephone conversations at first and then a face to face with the Dr this is now being treated. 
I had also been in extreme pain, my shoulder at first and then the rest of my arm. Again with an examination from the Dr this has also being managed through the advice given.
My experience throughout was that the GP was keen for get to the problems and followed up when they said they would.  Speak with a friend some days later it was clear they had had pretty much the same positive experience.

title: Highly Recommended
body: We had our COVID-19 vaccines at this excellent surgery. They were extremely well organised, helpful and friendly.

title: Excellent treatment
body:
I had to see the doctor.  I wrote an e-consult and got a phone call, then a face to face the next day. I was referred to the hospital quickly.
This was the most efficient part of my treatment, thank you very much for all your hard work during the pandemic.

title: Really great practice
body:
A really great practice where the doctors care about the patients
 and are extremely considerate and proactive at resolving health 
 issues. The admin staff are also highly efficient and friendly. 
 Health  checks are instigated by the practice and everyone seems  driven to make this an exceptional place. Would highly recommend this great practice.

title: Extremely Unprofessional
body: I left the surgery in tears today after a very poor and unprofessional experience with one of the medical team. I have made a formal complaint and will be complaining to NHS England. No one should be made to feel as I was today. You go to what you think is a safe environment where your health concerns are listened to with empathy and understanding. This was not the case. Felt very tearful , misunderstood and upset and very let down. It was if I was there for this particular person not the other way around.

title: Reliable local practice
body: I've been very impressed with the GP service in lockdown - GPs have been available on the phone and for remote consultation, usually same day, and the process of issuing prescriptions has been smooth and effective, as well as quick. I've had occasion to visit in person as well during this time and found both administration and treatment to be calm and well-managed.

title: amazing practice
body: i had a face to face appointment, i came out very eased and reassuared about what i went in for, by far the best experience.

title: Breast Clinic
body: Such friendly staff. I was listened to. Advice was explained fully. I festooned after from start to finish.

title: Good doctors, sorted quickly
body:
I had to see the doctors here for a serious problem. The receptionist was kind and got me seen quickly and the doctor sorted it all out for me and referred me to the hospital.
They’re obviously under a lot of pressure but are still compassionate.

title: Thank you to Tilney ward
body: You have treated my mother who experienced excellent care through our her stay. Very impressed with the way consultants worked as a team. Cheerful and efficient nurses.

readBy.name: The Queen Elizabeth Hospital Kings Lynn NHS Foundation Trust

author: Marbz84
title: A & E
body: I would just like to thank the amazing A & E department for the care they gave my mum when she was admitted on a late Saturday night. The whole team went above and beyond and saved my mums life, I will never be able to thank you enough. My mum is still poorly in Sheffield hospital but on the road to recovery thanks to the brilliant doctor who cared for her and continually kept me informed what was happening.

author: hydrussk99
title: Vaccination
body: Everything went just fine. Very professional. Would vaccinate here again

title: Excellent and efficient care
body: West Hampstead regularly provides an excellent service. The staff are kind, understanding and supportive and work hard to look after their patients. The online service has also made things more efficient and accessible. My husband and I feel very fortunate to be members of this practice. Thank you.

title: Practice makes perfect ! Far from perfect🥸
body: Ok left a review , but not ‘viewed’  yet . So 2 different Covid jabs 1 on 31st Jan 2021 Pfizer  , 2nd version 28th Feb AZ version . Protocol says 2 of one version  , see review by ‘meta/tarsal’. Now I review my records and they say I had 1 Pfizer on 31st January , and one AZ all on the same day !. Rang nhs , 20m wait , finally explained total situation , call handler completely perplexed , spoke to supervisor . Incredulous slightly amused responses overheard, how on earth did he get 2 different, how on earth are his records still wrong , why haven’t they contacted him! More laughter then another discussion in another language , so no feed back on that . Then put onto more inane music , then CUT OFF ! What happens next !!!! No response from Lilliput surgery yet , must still be tenth in queue. How about a call Practice Manager . This all needs resolving , may get better feedback from Daily Mail ? Or NWNF approach. I understand that if another jab due to make at least 2 of 1 within 12 weeks it may not count. And present situation does not qualify for travel ! Let’s not forget 6 months old foot injury not dealt with yet. Signing off for now! But not going away . Meta/tarsal

title: Great practice
body: I have only just joined this practice but the  staff due to Covid lock down the staff have been amazing friendly and very helpful nothing has been too much trouble I just want to say a massive thank you to all of the staff

title: Fantastic team
body: I have found every staff member kind, compassionate, clinically knowledgeable & very attentive. Have never felt rushed despite (as I work in NHS) how much immense pressure they are under. Thank you WHMC

title: AAU Nobody answers the phone
body: Father admitted via the hotline quite unwell, due to Covid unable to visit and speak with staff for updates therefore have to ring the unit no reply constantly, really poor when you have a family member on the unit and you cannot get an update at any time of day or night

title: Amazing staff -thank you!
body: My mum had to attend the Manchester royal infirmary A and E dept on Tuesday night between 10.30pm and we left at approx 3.50am. We would like to thank each and every member of staff we had contact with from the security lady and gentleman who were professional and supportive in their very difficult role on the door; the 2 triage staff who were so welcoming, efficient and made it feel as though they had all the time to listen and care then the 2 staff at reception after triage again so caring and reassuring and then the wonderfully patient, caring, calm nurses particularly the lead nurse who dealt with a particularly loud and disgruntled patient with dignity and such professionalism and eventually the caring and efficient dr who saw my mum. I cannot imagine the immense pressure that they were all under but the way they all treated every single person who came through their care with same level of support and help was truly wonderful. We would to thank them for making such a huge difference to what was a very traumatic experience. Please pass on our deep appreciation and thanks.

title: Very efficient
body: Just had my COVID vaccine and the staff were amazing. Very organised and I was in and out in a very short space of time. I think the longest part was waiting 15 minutes after the vaccine to make sure everyone is okay. Fantastic service!

title: Great practice with great staff
body: I've with the surgery over 10 years and the staff and doctors are very helpful and supportive. The receptionist are very helpful and polite.

author: 01megan
title: Dreadful service
body:
Received dreadful service at East Glade. No contact via email since December 2020. Support worker makes no attempt. Other workers have disappeared off the face of the earth. Haven't seen a Dr since Feb 2020. Albeit covid, many practices do have video consultations. It wouldn't be difficult to arrange.  
Complaints raised but never registered. I would be interested to know why a complaint raised last month has not been acknowledged within the 3 days stated.

readBy.name: Sheffield Health and Social Care NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent Practice
body: To sum up I’d say Efficient, Friendly and Knowledgable. Could not fault. Makes visiting a practice almost pleasurable.

author: bracepe56
title: Poor communication from reception
body:
Average 30 mins to get through to speak to someone everytime you phone. Just this week alone 2 appointments failed. I attended Jordanthorpe for 2nd jab to find it closed, I had not been informed that the first app had been changed. On phoning doctors on I was informed I had been texted previously. Had I received a text on my mobile or a message by land line I would not have gone to Jordanthorpe clinic or got wet through due to the weather. Second appointment I attended after I had been told it was the Astra Zeneca vaccine, to be told by a nurse and those in charge at the clinic that it was Pfizer vaccine being given and that reception had been asked to phone that morning to tell me not to come in, as it had been noticed when they got the list of patients first thing that morning. My app was 11.50am and again no one bothered to contact me. So I have now got to attend for a 3rd time.  
It is no good pulling patients down about appointments they do not attend. Thats when you can get one, when reception is giving out wrong information or not even contacting people. I was informed by one receptionist in a rather abrupt tone that there are 20, 000 patients at the health centre.  
If thats the case then they should employ more receptionists to deal with phone calls and the receptionists to be properly trained so they give out the correct information then patients would not get frustrated and annoyed at the service they are getting. It cuts both ways and like it or not since the two surgeries have joined together the service has deteriorated big time. There are too many patients for one surgery and in this area there is not another surgery without travelling to Woodseats or Bradway.  
I do not have a computer and have used my brothers, receptionists seemed to think everyone has a mobile or computer but this is not the case.  
If you complain you are made to feel that the staff are never in the wrong and the problem is you. It was never like this before the merger.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)
Meadowgreen Health Centre & The Avenue Medical Practice

title: Early Afternoon blood tests
body:
I was delighted hear from a Doctor during a appointment ,afternoon blood tests are available

This is valuable to me, following my brain injury, I have many post brain injury symptoms ,one is a sleeping disorder and also complex ,neuropathic /thalamic pain syndrome ,both make sleeping difficult , and struggle to attend morning appointments

My previous GP surgeries referred me to Hospital for my blood tests, due to not being unable to accommodate my need for afternoon blood test appointments 
The lunch time collection of blood samples made this impossible 

Since joining Penrose Street surgery ,I've attended afternoon blood test appointments in December 2020 ,a afternoon appointment was made for January 2021 ,but for an unexplained reason and witout  notification this appointment was suddenly cancelled and I found myself attending hospital for this blood test in February and March 2021 ?
However ,I have  since attended further afternoon blood test appointment in April ,and May 2021 at Penrose Street Surgery

author: Tropbon
title: Treatment for High Blood Pressure
body: After attending A& E I was asked to attend Ward 9 for the Ambulatory Clinic at the Ulster Hospital. This is the first time as an adult that I have attended hospital and I was very uncomfortable with it. I was anxious about what was wrong with me and had no idea what was going to happen. The doctors (Josh & Chris) were fantastic. They took the time to explain what was going on and were very patient. The nurses and support workers also were very helpful and it made the experience less stressful overall.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Very caring team
body: In my recent experiences of pregnancy loss I've found the team to be patient, caring and supportive. I often feel listened to and understood which is very reassuring. In general over the past 2 years, I have found most of the doctors, nurses and reception staff to be friendly and efficient. There are occasional blips but these are to be expected to a certain extent, especially as things are very busy at the moment.

title: Great service
body:
I, and my family, have been in Warminster for almost 50 years now. We have been with Avenue from its establishment, and previously with the forerunner, Portway surgery. 
We have always found the surgery to give excellent service, and we have had great doctors. This past year has been very difficult for everyone, but on the occasions when I have needed help, the surgery has never failed me. I accept, that on the occasions when I really feel a need to see my own doctor, I may have to wait a while, but if I have needed an urgent consultation, then I have always been able to see or speak to someone. 
I’m not too keen on the, recently introduced, “appointment on the day” , arrangement but when needed, this week, I had no trouble. 
I would definitely recommend this practice to anyone. 
I would definitely give the practice 5 stars!!

title: Excellent Person Centred Care
body: All members of the clinical and administrative teams who have dealt with the ongoing complex needs of my mother have worked thoroughly and compassionately in addressing her care needs. A personal approach which has been flexible and all encompassing of a range of factors demonstrating clear communication at all times, highlighted that my mother was at the centre of all actions and decisions made. Her health and emotional wellbeing has been a priority when addressing her needs professionally. For what has been an extremely challenging time, the practice has been a pillar of support and empathy making things a whole lot easier to deal with for our family.

title: Great practice
body: I have joined the practice at the beginning of the year and have been a few times for various issues. Overall I enjoyed the experience, staff is prepared and really nice; facilities are clean.

title: Great practice and amazing Doctor
body: Came in to the surgery for a follow-up consultation. The service and the staff were outstanding. The doctor explained the procedure very well and made me feel very comfortable.

title: Laser Surgery
body:
I was seen in the eye clinic on the 10th May.  I just wanted to say thank you to the gentleman who gave me treatment at 9.30 on the 10th for a torn retina. It was so good to be seen so quickly and receive the laser treatment to repair my eye.
Many thanks for his good handy work.

readBy.name: Northern Lincolnshire and Goole NHS Foundation Trust

title: Exceptional Receptionist
body: I rang Ballater Surgery on behalf of my Mum and spoke to a Receptionist who was very compassionate and helpful.  She went out of her way to explain things to me and gave me advice on who to speak to at the Surgery.  It was really refreshing to be listened to and for action to be taken.  She is an absolute asset to the team.

title: Good first impressions
body: New patient at WHMC. I have had a number of interactions with the practice and have found the staff to be very helpful, proactive and responsive.

title: Amazing staff
body: I could not put into words how happy I am with my experience at Southend hospital, I am supposed to be with a different hospital but after visiting Southend I will be swapping to have my baby there. The midwifes are so kind and reassuring, waiting times are nothing in comparison to most hospitals, there’s nothing I could fault. Thank you so much for such a lovely experience, I am finally looking forward to giving birth now I know I will be around such a amazing team.

readBy.name: Mid Essex Hospital Services NHS Trust

title: Covid Vaccine
body: Just like to say I've had both vaccines at this surgery and was impressed on how well  organised and efficient and helpful the staff inside and out were to make  sure the appointments ran smoothly- well done to everyone involved!

title: Hardworking practice
body:
I think the practice, the staff, all the doctors, nurses, office staff and everyone involved are very hardworking and pleasant. 
Yes it can be hard to get through on the phones sometimes but the operator on the other end only has so many appointments and have always done their best to help me. The online system needs improvement and I have only ever been able to get one appointment on there but it’s handy.
I think once the new improved phone and the on line system has been installed it will make a huge difference. 
They would also benefit from more staff to make it even more efficient.
Personally I would like to thank everyone at the Fountain Medical centre, especially through the pandemic.
My family and I have huge respect for the NHS and think you do a great job and the  best you can with the tools you have.

title: Great staff!
body: Reception at 715am was amazing, very helpful and listened then acted - no preconceived ideas - thank you for making me feel heard!

title: Seamless vaccine process
body: Smooth and easy vaccine process - very well organised. Bit of a queue for first jab, absolutely no queue second time around. Couldn't have been easier.

title: Very well organised
body: I visited this surgery for my Covid-19 vaccines. During both visits staff were very professional and well organised.

title: Emergency early pregnancy unit- so helpful!
body: I am so glad I found this service which was sent to me by a friend. I started bleeding over the weekend and rang their 24 hr free helpline and they called me back within the hour at 2am. They asked me to come down to the hospital and did many checks  Unfortunately, I had a miscarriage but the staff were incredible. They brought me back 3 times that week to check me over and take blood tests and a lovely, caring nurse rang me to ask how I was. What an amazing NHS service and I am so thankful for all their help.

title: Great Practice / CTC team
body:
I like to give a positive feedback to the staff working in the reception team for the hard work during current covid-19 crises. The prompt positive action taken to get CTC nurse onsite at home resulted in my mum being admitted to King George Hospital. She is now back at home.
To all the reception team members at Goodmayes Medical Centre & CTC team. A BIG TAHNK-YOU

title: Issues getting through for blood test appointment
body: This is not the first time I have had problems with this surgery its been numerous occasions! I've been trying to book an appointment for blood test and asthma for 2 months. I rang 40 times before I got through (waiting over 1 hrs on the phone)and was told there was no appointments available. As it isn't possible to get through reception they should alowe this to book online.

title: Extremely User UN-Friendly
body: It is literally impossible to speak to anyone within the vaccination team to amend your appointment- you are sent pillar to post and have hours of your life wasted with people passing the buck and simply told they cannot help you- even if they are in the same building! Absolutely absurd that nobody wants to help and there is no way to directly contact regarding your appointment. Poor service

title: Brilliant!
body:
Having a serious injury recently and being hospitalised, the follow up , care and treatment I got from this surgery was brilliant!!
Without me asking, they called to check up on me and provided everything I need  to aid my recovery!! As I continue to recover, it's great to know they are looking after me. 
Many thanks to all the staff!!

title: Fantastic Unit
body:
Visited this unit whilst on holidaying in Chudleigh.
As a retired nurse, I cannot re commend this unit enough. The efficiency, professionalism and friendliness of staff was second to none! 90 minutes  from checking in to leaving having been triaged, assessed, xrayed and treated!
Thankyou so much x

readBy.name: Torbay and South Devon NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great for people who don’t like blood test
body: The practice overall is great, other than very busy but the phlebotomy in particular is brilliant, I hate blood tests and always get super nervous but I’m always put at ease by the phleblotomists who do such a fantastic job, making the whole process as quick and painless as possible. I would much rather visit my doctors for bloods to be taken than anywhere else.
